casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Tracy James BLACK, Appellant. WD 80580 Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District. ORDER FILED: November 6, 2018 Attorneys: Steven Willibey, Kansas City, MO, Counsel for Appellant. Attorneys: Gregory Barnes, Jefferson City, MO, Counsel for Respondent. Before Division Two: Alok Ahuja, P.J., Thomas H. Newton, and Mark D. Pfeiffer, JJ.

ORDER

Per Curiam:

Mr. Tracy J. Black appeals his convictions by a Lafayette County jury for first-degree robbery and armed criminal action, stemming from a liquor-store robbery in September 2014 in Lexington, Missouri. The trial court sentenced him as a prior and persistent offender to two consecutive terms of twenty-five years' imprisonment. For reasons stated in the memorandum provided to the parties, we affirm. Rule 30.25(b).
